messages.content: Is it realistic to have a radio transmitter transmitting signals at 4000 dBW?

No, this is an impossible demand for any radio transmitter. The reason is that the power level demanded by the question is 4000 times greater than the -50 dBW or 0.00001 pW, the typical power level of noise generated by everything in our universe.
This is only 6 times greater than -50 dBW, and is therefore a more achievable demand to achieve than 4000 dBW.
